result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Michael Stephenson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:52 AM Defendant Lucas Michael Stephenson in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Lucas Michael Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel requests another status in 45 days.  State has no objection, requests sooner rather than later. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:14 PM   Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas Michael Stephenson in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Lucas Michael Stephenson.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel requests another status in 90 days, needs to do some further investigation in the latest file.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Viel requests a status in 90 days.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.

1:31 PM Defendant Lucas Michael Stephenson in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Lucas Michael Stephenson.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:16 AM  Defendant Lucas Michael Stephenson appeared by video, Attorney Shannon Viel appeared in court for Lucas Michael Stephenson, Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Court will have Atty Viel set prelim. with JA Parks after court today.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:10 PM Defendant Lucas Michael Stephenson appeared by video from the Door County Jail, Attorney Shannon Viel appeared by video for Lucas Michael Stephenson, Attorney Colleen Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Viel requests AIA be set.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
